column5: [QUOTE=RichA$1970;6742885]Quote: Originally Posted by 10pointQuote: Originally Posted by RichA$1970John, you have the knack as I’ve fished 2 days on Eagle with 17 pike and 1 musky so far. Surprised not a walleye has taken a shot at my lures but have had a pike fry and the weather is getting better as I caught these 2 the first hour this morning.What part of the lake are you fishing?Smith Bay thanks to John / Prov1800 who has been spot on, very impressive of his knowledge
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6742899]Eck, Glad its his backyard or I’d be struggling
[QUOTE=RichA$1970;6742929]No doud't by the looks of the pics you in the right spot,it pays to get some great advice.

Got out yesterday for my first guide day.Been a while since covid that I fished the east end of Eagle out of North Shore lodge.Was in a private boat and didn't have my sonar/gps unit.Really don't need it and found lots of active walleye spots and bass spots to keep my guests busy all week.Nothing bigger than eaters.Even did my first shorelunch Bit rusty but went good.Fishing was amazing especially the bass fishing which is on 🔥. Weather was a bit on the hot side and very calm so we could actually sight fish.
Lots of smiles in those pictures,great looking weather,alittle cooler temps would feel better,sweatshirt weather is nice.
Great pics! Looking forward to August!
It's a big lake Rich.Takes time to adjust to it.make the trip to spots I sent you.Youll get the walleyes
That one there Rich will feed you for a week.lol,nice fish,looks like nice weather also.
shorts, t shirts, flat water, smallmouth , looks perfect to me....
What part of the lake are you fishing?
